section.name: Run a development package
section.span: How to build the package of a project and run it, all on the fly?
section.p: In production, the Hippo CMS and any addons are run by deploying the application wars in an application server, but during development you will want to have a faster way, testing and improving your application often during your development cycle.

To facilitate development it is possible to run Hippo CMS together with any addons using maven commands and kill the running CMS using Ctrl-C. Assuming that the project directory is '~/cms' (after you have checked out the Hippo CMS source to it):
section.source: > cd ~/cms ~/cms> mvn install ~/cms> cd quickstart/war ~/cms/quickstart/war> mvn clean jetty:run-war
section.p: Maven uses the application server Jetty, which is included with Maven. mvn install does the same as mvn package (i.e. building the packages) and in addition puts all project artifacts (jars, wars) in your local maven repository, as required by the maven-jetty-plugin.
Jetty and the Hippo CMS have now started and the CMS can be accessed via your web browser at http://localhost:8080/cms/, logging in as admin/admin.

Note that in the sample application started from the command line is a quickstart version of the Hippo CMS suite. If you require a production build, want to extend Hippo CMS or just want a clean start you should use the cms/package/war of cms/package/ear project.
